value.title: Backup Driver In Self-Driving Uber That Killed Woman Pleads Guilty To Endangerment
value.excerpt: PHOENIX (AP) — The backup Uber driver for a self-driving vehicle that killed a pedestrian in suburban Phoenix in 2018 pleaded guilty Friday to endangerment in the first fatal collision involving a fully autonomous car.

value.title: Can Self-Driving Go Mainstream Within 10 Years? Watch This Debate
value.excerpt: CMU Professor Raj Rajkumar, of the DARPA challenge winning team faces off with Brad Templeton on the core question

value.title: Artificial intelligence will impact workplaces and cost some workers their jobs
value.excerpt: A new report from the McKinsey Global Institute says some will lose their jobs and low-wage workers are the most likely to be hit.

value.title: Another Tesla With Full Self-Driving Beta Blasts Through A Red Light
value.excerpt: A former Tesla employee has shared a frightening video online that shows a Tesla model equipped with the company’s Full Self-Driving beta running a red light in the U.S. John Bernal once worked as an advanced driver assistance systems test operator for Tesla but was fired last year after sharing videos on YouTube of the FSD Beta misbehaving in California.

value.title: Waymo pushes back its self-driving truck efforts to focus on ride hailing
value.excerpt: Waymo justified the decision by pointing to "significant" growth in demand for its robotaxis in Los Angeles, Phoenix and San Francisco. It also noted rapid upgrades to Driver, the AI system that handles its autonomous cars. There's "tremendous momentum" in One, the co-chiefs say, and the new strategy will help make the most of this trend.

value.title: US lawmakers struggle to find deal on self-driving cars
value.excerpt: Congress still faces serious hurdles to winning approval for long-stalled legislation to speed the adoption of self-driving cars.

value.title: BMW’s valet parking test trades red vests for remote driving rigs
value.excerpt: Part of the autonomous driving dream is the ability to jump out of your vehicle in front of the store, mall, concert hall, or museum and let the car find its own parking while you enjoy life. No more creeping along in garages thinking you found the perfect spot, only to have your delight dashed by the motorcycle you couldn't quite see.

value.title: Driverless cars could get AI-powered heat vision for nighttime driving
value.excerpt: Self-driving vehicles that struggle with recognising objects at night could get a boost from a heat-assisted detection and ranging system

value.title: Nvidia Stock Investors Should Love What Elon Musk Said on Tesla's Earnings Call About AI
value.excerpt: As usual, CEO Elon Musk and the top execs who joined him on the earnings call provided some great information for Tesla investors. But Musk also made comments that were relevant to investors and potential investors in graphics chip specialist Nvidia ( NVDA 2.24%), which is the main focus of this article.

value.title: Tesla Owners Can Transfer Full Self-Driving Capabilities To a New Vehicle For Free
value.excerpt: To transfer full self-driving capabilities you’ll need to forfeit the ability on your current Tesla vehicle. The software can be removed as early as one week before the scheduled delivery of your new Tesla, so you’ll also likely be without it for a bit while you’re waiting.

value.title: An AI-generated ‘South Park’ episode, Microsoft’s security woes, and Tesla’s first Cybertruck build
value.excerpt: In this edition of Week in Review, we cover the AI-generated "South Park" episode, Microsoft's security woes and Tesla's first Cybertruck build.

value.title: Tesla offers customers one-time Full Self-Driving transfer until September 30th
value.excerpt: Tesla has started notifying owners that they can transfer the Full Self-Driving feature they purchased to a new vehicle, as long as they take delivery within the next three months..

value.excerpt: Founded in 1993 by brothers Tom and David Gardner, The Motley Fool helps millions of people attain financial freedom through our website, podcasts, books, newspaper column, radio show, and premium investing services. A new bull market may be upon us, and there's a simple reason for it: artificial intelligence (AI).

value.title: Artificial Intelligence on the Battlefield: Lawmakers weigh the risks and benefits of military AI
value.excerpt: “The country that is able to most rapidly and effectively integrate new technology into warfighting wins,” Alexandr Wang, CEO of Scale AI, said. “If we don’t win on AI, we risk ceding global influence, technological leadership and democracy to strategic adversaries like China.”

value.title: 25 Millionaire-Maker AI Stocks to Buy Now
value.excerpt: “The AI megatrend is just getting started. ChatGPT really kickstarted this AI frenzy back in November 2022. We’re basically just seven months into the AI Boom. By comparison, the Internet Boom lasted almost 10 years – from the launch of the world’s first website in 1991 to the peak of the dot-com bubble in 2000.

value.title: This Changed the Way I Look for AI Stocks Forever
value.excerpt: The good news is the AI bubble - which still has a little air left in it - is starting to shrink as investors come to their senses and realize that a $2-per-share bottling that slapped"AI" in its name this March isn't going to hit $487.

value.title: Three Career Choices That Will Not Be Impacted By AI
value.excerpt: Professions that require complex decision-making, creativity and empathy are difficult to replace by machines.
